channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Flights resume at London Heathrow after a daylong closure sparked travel chaos
item.description: Heathrow Airport said it was "fully operational" on Saturday, after an almost daylong closure sparked by an electrical substation fire. But airlines w...

item.title: DHS revokes legal protections for 532,000 Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans and Venezuelans
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security's new policy, revoking legal protections for hundreds of thousands, impacts people who are already in the U.S. and...

item.title: Can't-miss interviews: Martha Stewart, Japanese Breakfast and an astronaut
item.description: Rounding up the big interviews you might have missed, from gardening tips with Martha Stewart to a conversation with a former astronaut about what hap...

item.title: Bernie Sanders is drawing record crowds as he pushes Democrats to 'fight oligarchy'
item.description: The populist message of Sen. Bernie Sanders' "Fighting Oligarchy" tour has resonated with voters frustrated by President Trump's agenda — and the Demo...

item.title: South Sudan "on the brink" UN warns amid renewed violence
item.description: The worlds youngest country teetering on the brink of another conflict and the possibility of regional war.

item.title: Hundreds arrested in third night of Turkey protests
item.description: Police arrested Istanbul's mayor, a key opposition figure, on Wednesday, sparking protests.

item.title: 3/21: CBS Evening News
item.description: Judge rebukes Trump administration for ignoring orders in deportation flights case; Mariah Carey wins "All I Want for Christmas Is You" copyright disp...

item.title: Abortion once more plays a key role in a state political fight, this time in Wisconsin’s court race
Eye on America: NIL’s impact on college sports, and a movement inspires Black med students
item.description: In Michigan, we report on how student-athletes’ newfound ability to profit off their name, image and likeness has profoundly changed the economics of ...

item.title: Heavyweight boxing legend George Foreman dies aged 76
item.description: Foreman won his first world heavyweight championship in 1973 and lost it a year later to Muhammad Ali in the famous Rumble in the Jungle fight.

item.title: Why Trump is struggling to secure fast ceasefire in Ukraine
item.description: Trump said he would end the war in Ukraine in 24 hours. The reality is proving far more difficult.

item.title: Family members missing after leaving Grand Canyon, driving through storm
item.description: The family members were driving from the Grand Canyon area to Las Vegas in a rented white 2024 BMW, officials said.

item.title: George Foreman, boxing legend and entrepreneur, dies at 76
item.description: George Foreman, an Olympic gold medalist and two-time heavyweight champion, competed between 1967 and 1997.

item.title: Israel strikes Lebanon after first rocket attack since ceasefire
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu has promised "to act forcefully" after the rocket attack into northern Israel.

item.title: The Uplift: Doctor hero
item.description: A Baltimore doctor who doesn't charge his patients realizes it's those patients who have made him a rich man with their generosity towards him. A man ...

item.title: New Hampshire town elections offer a preview of citizenship voting rules being considered nationwide
item.description: New Hampshire has tested out its new law requiring people to show proof of citizenship before registering to vote.

item.title: Trump revokes security clearance for Harris, Clinton and others
item.description: The US president also confirmed he was revoking the security clearance of Joe Biden and "any other member" of the Biden family.

item.title: Under threat from Trump, Columbia University agrees to policy changes
